item.title: Ticket #537 (bad Last-Modified header breaks some RSS readers) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #537 (bad Last-Modified header breaks some RSS readers) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: When I tried to access my WordPress 1.2.1 blog using SharpReader v0.9.5.1, the latter would report "Error reading URL: The underlying connection was closed: The server committed an HTTP protocol violation." and would fail to list any of the blog items.

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description:
This fixes it... although it's a bandaid solution:

function clean_amp_chars($text){ $search = "/&([a-zA-Z0-9#]{3,10});/i"; $replace = "&$1;"; $text = preg_replace($search, $replace, $text); return $text; } add_filter('comment_author', 'clean_amp_chars', 100); add_filter('comment_text', 'clean_amp_chars', 100);

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: Owner, Priority, Status, Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #405 (Trackback title format bungs up HTML entities) updated
item.dc:creator: MC_incubus
item.description: The same happens for PingBack titles. I've been trying to create a regex that would fix this... we need to look for & followed by X chars and ";"

item.title: Ticket #536 (Quicktags cause jump to top of post in firefox.) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description:
This was fixed in CVS back in September: ​http://wordpress.org/pipermail/cvs_wordpress.org/2004-September/000353.html (fix is easily implemented for those w/ WP v1.2)

This bug is also a replica of bug 443: ​http://mosquito.wordpress.org/view.php?id=443

item.title: Ticket #443 (Quicktags return cursor to top of textarea in longer posts) updated
item.dc:creator: coffee2code
item.description: This was fixed in CVS back in September: ​http://wordpress.org/pipermail/cvs_wordpress.org/2004-September/000353.html (fix is easily implemented for those w/ WP v1.2)

item.title: Ticket #536 (Quicktags cause jump to top of post in firefox.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #536 (Quicktags cause jump to top of post in firefox.) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: In firefox, but in no other browser, when one uses a quicktag, wordpress will automaticly scroll up to the top of ones post. This is extremley annoying, allthough not big enough to stop ones use. It has been reproduced in safari 1.0 on two different computers, with different blogs. It does not happen in IE or safari, though opera has not been tested.

item.title: Ticket #535 (Add note to options-permalink.php on properly ending URI structure) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Patch changed

item.title: Ticket #535 (Add note to options-permalink.php on properly ending URI structure) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: Not properly terminating custom permalinks, using either %postname% or %post_id%, can lead to problems (refer: ​http://wordpress.org/support/3/18325). A notice to that effect should be added to options-permalink.php.

Since this can already be done using a plugin, and that is the preferred way of handling specific feature requirements, please try that. I will leave this as a feature request.
